name: January 28, 1986, Prior to the Space Shuttle Challenger Crash
description:
The Space Shuttle Challenger disaster was a fatal accident in the United States space program that occurred on January 28, 1986, when the Space Shuttle Challenger broke apart 73 seconds into its flight, killing all seven crew members aboard; it was the first fatal accident involving an American spacecraft in flight. 
Date: January 28, 1986
Cause: O-ring seal failure in right SRB
Inquiries: Rogers Commission Report
Location: Florida, Cape Canaveral, Atlantic Ocean
